alert.note: Alert for Wakulla (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 03 at 8:11PM EST until December 04 at 8:20PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343) affecting Wakulla County. For the Sopchoppy River...including Sopchoppy (FR 343)...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Sopchoppy River near Sopchoppy (FR 343). * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 30.0 feet, The Painted Bridge begins to flood at this level. Homes on stilts in low lying areas in the city of Sopchoppy will experience flooding on the ground level. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Sunday the stage was 30.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:30 PM EST Sunday was 30.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest near 30.6 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage on Monday. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 30.7 feet on 09/23/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Monday afternoon at 215 PM EST.
